channel.title: kicksecure-debian: dpkg-divert: warning: diverting file '/etc/issue' from an Essential package w ith rename is dangerous, use --no-rename
channel.description:
Following documentation here:
http://www.dds6qkxpwdeubwucdiaord2xgbbeyds25rbsgr73tbfpqpt4a6vjwsyd.onion/wiki/Kicksecure/Debian
I got a warning during the installation of kicksecure-cli:
Adding 'diversion of /etc/issue to /etc/issue.kicksecure-orig by kicksecure-b ase-files' dpkg-divert: warning: diverting file '/etc/issue' from an Essential package w ith rename is dangerous, use --no-rename Adding 'diversion of /etc/motd to /etc/motd.kicksecure-orig by kicksecure-bas e-files' Adding 'diversion of /etc/skel/.bashrc to /etc/skel/.bashrc.kicksecure-orig b y kicksecure-base-files' dpkg-divert: warning: diverting file '/etc/skel/.bashrc' from an Essential pa ckage with rename is dangerous, use --no-rename
Thought to report it if its important to be fixed,documented...etc
Note: Warning of using apt-key is deprecated is as well gonna show up during the process.

item.title: kicksecure-debian: dpkg-divert: warning: diverting file '/etc/issue' from an Essential package w ith rename is dangerous, use --no-rename
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
That is OK.

TNT_BOM_BOM:

Note: Warning of using apt-key is deprecated is as well gonna show up during the process.

apt-key Deprecation / Apt 2.2 changes Development
Interesting changes: apt-key and trusted.gpg are slated for deprecation. Users should move on to trusted.gpg.d instead. Our guides need to be updated to reflect that. @torjunkie please feel free to look at it when you have time. There’s discussion about moving from GPG entirely for apt… New features Various patterns related to dependencies, such as ?depends are now available (2.1.16) The Protected field is now supported. It replaces the previous Important field and is like Essential, …

Read full topic
item.source: kicksecure-debian: dpkg-divert: warning: diverting file '/etc/issue' from an Essential package w ith rename is dangerous, use --no-rename

ase-files'

e-files'

y kicksecure-base-files'

ckage with rename is dangerous, use --no-rename

Thought to report it if its important to be fixed,documented…etc
